page.title: 12Attitudes in St.Albans.
page.content: This info. was obtained from {local {papers and editors.Attitudes}about St. Albans and its environment have changed little over the years.To the fore are{opinions}about:{dogs fouling {footpaths;car parking; preservation vs {development;employment;education.}The city attracts tourists but{parking {facilities}are seen as insufficient and/or too expensive.{The council}have acted cautiously in the development of the {city centre}because of the desire to {preserve older buildings.}This has upset{tradespeople}who say that if the city is to be a{tourist attraction}the shops should reflect this.New shopping precincts are now being developed.The{ {community}has always shown an interest in Educ.{The school meals service}was saved due to public pressure.{Amalga- {mation of schools}and reductions in{ {school budgets}is causing concern.
